result.execSummary:
All charges against Wali J Ali in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Wali J Ali is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wali J Ali

records.addlTxt: Copy of minutes from PH Hrg on 8/11/22 sent electronically to DCJ

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant Wali J Ali in court, in custody.  Attorney Trisha Simmons for Tim Helmberger in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Guy Cardamone in court for Wali J Ali. Officer LF duly sworn and testified. Direct by ADA Simmons. Venue established.  DE identified. Cross. Redirect. State moves for b/o, waives argument for rebuttal. DE objects to b/o, argument. Court does not find PC on ct 2. Argument by ADA Simmons as to PC on count 1. Argument by Attorney Cardamone. Court does not find PC on ct 1. State requests bond continue for 72 hours for re-file.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:47 AM Defendant in court, in custody.  Tracy L McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant on status of obtaining private attorney. Defendant states he should have one by next week. Court sets for Preliminary hearing and he must have attorney or the Court may proceed with preliminary hearing.

11:10 AM Defendant in court, in custody.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defn states he's hiring a private attorney. Court colloquy off the record with defen regarding time limits. 
Defn states he wishes to have an atty represent him at a preliminary hearing and waives time limits. Status conf set and notice in hand given. Bail continues

ADDRESS INFO for Wali J Ali
Current: Dane Co Jail,   (Effective: 06-28-2022)
Prior: 1186 Moorland Rd, Madison, WI 53562
Status conference on July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 5

03:29 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Guy Cardamone.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
